channel.title: Clean RSPS server & client
channel.description:
Hello,
My account is older, but i'm quite new to the community. It's a long timo ago I surfed around on these forums, and my interest in RSPS came back a few days ago. When I first met with RSPS, I just copy/paste things into the source, and hoped it worked without any knowledge about anything in Java. I now have some experience in Java itself and I want to have something to work on.
I want an clean server and client, what I mean with this is a source that isn't modified at all or only a bit. Something to work on without needing to edit other's their code, just something that is relative clean.
I surfed around the downloads section but really cound't found anything like this. I was wondering if someone can help me here, in this board. My appologies if this topic is in the wrong section.
For the 'version', around 718, but not too new. I like it when it was around 718.
Wout

item.title: Clean RSPS server & client
item.dc:creator: @woutiboy woutiboy
item.description:
@woutiboy wrote:

my-swagger:

Use Azure if you’re thinking about RuneSource.

Googeled for it, but can’t seem to find azure itself without downloading someone’s version of it.

[quote=“Pure_, post:4, topic:552519”][quote author=woutiboy link=topic=671435.msg4490148#msg4490148 date=1437230695]

Hello! I would recommend RuneSource as a first base so you don’t deal with complex networking structures although it is still nio. Then move onto apollo/hyperion/scape-emu/whatever else.

I googled RuneSource and found this:

GitHub

KeithCharles/runesource

Contribute to runesource development by creating an account on GitHub.

Is this the correct github repo of runesource? Thanks for answering.

[/quote]That one uses netty so it may be out of your scope for a while.

MediaFire

original runesource & runesource netty.rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Use the ‘original’ one in the download with a fresh 317 client+cache.[/quote]
I will try this, al due I have some experience with netty. It isn’t completely new to me. Are there also people having an 718 base?

Read full topic

Hello! I would recommend RuneSource as a first base so you don’t deal with complex networking structures although it is still nio. Then move onto apollo/hyperion/scape-emu/whatever else.
[/quote]

Is this the correct github repo of runesource? Thanks for answering.[/quote]That one uses netty so it may be out of your scope for a while.

Use the ‘original’ one in the download with a fresh 317 client+cache.
